metadata.Title: CVE-2018-5135 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
WebExtensions can bypass normal restrictions in some circumstances and use "browser.tabs.executeScript" to inject scripts into contexts where this should not be allowed, such as pages from other WebExtensions or unprivileged "about:" pages. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 59.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-5135` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 59.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1
firefox-globalmenu - 59.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 59.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1
firefox-testsuite - 59.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '59.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1').
